page.title: 13FISHING
page.content: { FISHING} In Porthallow there are 15 fishing boats, two of which take tourists on fishing trips. The best place to catch fish is off the wreck of the 'Volany' which is one mile off shore. Another good place is White Rocks which is near Nare Point. Another wreck for fishing is that of the 'Panama' which went down in the 'Great Blizzard' of 1891. Mackerel and baby Pollack are two of the chief catches. Fishing off the rocks at Porthallow you can catch quite big Wrasse and sometimes little Dab. You can often find tackle on the beach. Fishing starts about May and carries on until about the end of September depending on the weather. There is a winch on the beach for pulling boats up; it is not very strong but it can help.
